channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Risks and Returns
item.description: This highly readable book contains numerous entertaining anecdotes about, and descriptions of, the lifestyles of the rich and famous. Readers’ interest will never flag as they glean the chunks of wisdom that they can productively apply to investment analysis.

item.title: Kamala Harris’ presidential prospects lift consumer sentiment
item.description: Americans' spirits are an important gauge for whether they're in the mood to shop; spending accounts for about 70% of U.S. economic activity.

item.title: 'Cowardly and unacceptable': Progressive NYC Dem condemns violent anti-Israel protest
item.description: Rep. Adriano Espaillat is condemning a violent protest that took place in the quiet upper Manhattan neighborhood of Hamilton Heights this week.

item.title: Radio's Rickey Smiley hits a raw nerve by pressuring Black voters to back Harris
item.description: A split in the Black community over Kamala Harris has erupted into a melee on social media.

item.title: Good Riddance to Minouche Shafik
item.description: Columbia has an opportunity to behave like an elite American college, but only if the outgoing president’s successors can grasp what she did not.

item.title: Georgia Board To Vote On Requiring Number Of Ballots Cast To Equal Number Of Voters
item.description: 'There’s a fundamental lack of accountability of our secretary of state. Those issues filter down to the counties — which is one reason why the elections board must provide oversight.'

item.title: Opportunities in the Evolving Cannabis Consumption Market
item.description: For investors in the space, the changing cannabis consumption landscape opens challenges and opportunities in product creation, marketing, and targeting new consumer groups.

item.title: The rich can’t sell their art, so they’re using it as collateral for cash loans
item.description: “There are margin calls, death, divorce and bankruptcy, so we have endless interest for lending,” says one advisor.

item.title: Walz vs. Vance: New poll reveals which vice presidential nominee is favored among voters
item.description: A Washington Post/ABC News/Ipsos poll found that Democratic vice presidential nominee Gov. Tim Walz has a higher favorability rating than Sen. JD Vance.

item.title: House Republicans press FBI for more information on Iran's role in plot to kill Trump
item.description: Key House Republicans are demanding answers from the Biden administration about the recent arrest of a Pakistani man in connection with an alleged Iranian plot to kill U.S. officials, presumably including former President Donald Trump, and about an apparent string of threats to American political figures emanating from Tehran.

item.title: The Conversation — Wiretapping America’s Soul
item.description: Coppola’s 1974 movie brings back social conscience.

item.title: You Don’t Need To Be Beyoncé To Sing With Your Friends
item.description: If we revived customs like spending evenings together sharing artistic achievement, no matter how small, we could strengthen communities and heal this country.

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: Meta pulled its disinformation tracker from Facebook months before America heads to the polls, and the EU isn’t happy
item.description: CrowdTangle was used by researchers to identify and track viral falsehoods, but it was closed without a replacement in place on Wednesday.

item.title: Former NYPD cop-turned-GOP candidate slams 'ludicrous' claims after $120K wrongful arrest settlements surface
item.description: New York Republican congressional candidate Insp. Alison Esposito [Ret.] came under fire on Thursday after details from previous wrongful-arrest affidavits were reported.

item.title: Three vulnerable Democratic senators will skip DNC
item.description: The three most vulnerable Democratic incumbent senators are reportedly skipping the party's convention next week.

item.title: The Ukrainian Invasion of Russia Is a Game-Changer
item.description: The Kursk offensive’s success will strengthen Ukraine’s hand in any future negotiations with the Kremlin.

item.title: Majority Of Postal Facilities Audited By Inspector General Failed To Follow Election Mail Procedures
item.description: These findings are indicative of a lack of understanding and training with respect to Election and Political Mail policy and procedures.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: ‘Black Swan’ hedge funder warns a recession is coming this year—and the biggest market bubble in history will soon pop
item.description: “It’s not different this time,” Mark Spitznagel, cofounder and CIO of the private hedge fund Universa Investments, told Fortune.

item.title: State funds to Dolton cut as embattled 'supermayor' Tiffany Henyard tries to reinstate indicted police chief
item.description: Some state funds to Dolton, Illinois, have been stopped over the town's alleged failure to submit financial records, where controversial Mayor Tiffany Henyard has been accused of excessive spending.

item.title: Texas, Heritage Foundation sue to stop Biden administration's 'transgender mandate' in workplace
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton is seeking to block the Biden administration's transgender directive, a newly enacted policy requiring employers to use the opposite-sex pronouns of male-born workers who identify as female and allow them access to women's restrooms and locker rooms.

item.title: J. D. Vance’s One-Track Mind for Railroad Regulation
item.description: A mandate backed by the VP hopeful wouldn’t make trains any safer, but it would damage the ability of the rail industry to pursue automation.

item.title: Everything The Biden-Harris Administration Doesn’t Want You To Know About Its Drug Price Controls
item.description: The Biden-Harris administration's scheme to establish socialist-style price controls is far worse than advertised.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Google’s ex-CEO isn’t licensed to give financial advice, but he thinks you should buy Nvidia
item.description: With tech firms investing "mind-boggling" amounts of money to win the AI race, their chip supplier of choice is the best positioned to win from the gold rush.

item.title: House Oversight investigating Walz over 'longstanding connections' to China
item.description: House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer, R-Ky., sent a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray, notifying the bureau of the committee’s investigation into Kamala Harris’ running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz.

item.title: Trump to resume outdoor rallies with bulletproof glass after Secret Service makes exception
item.description: Former President Donald Trump will reportedly return to outdoor rallies -- but with one change.

item.title: The Week: Trump’s Slip in the Polls
item.description: Plus: Ukraine’s surprise invasion of Russian territory.

item.title: CNN Trots Out B-List ‘Republican’ Coward To Push Voting For National Destruction
item.description: Useful idiots like Geoff Duncan appear 'unburdened by what has been' the disastrous public service record of Kamala Harris.
